newsitem.title: USA: Louisiana legislature opens with Medicaid plea.
newsitem.headline: Louisiana legislature opens with Medicaid plea.

text.p: Louisiana Gov. Mike Foster opened the state's 1997 legislative session with a plea to raise teacher salaries and fully fund the state's $3.1 billion Medicaid program.
In his opening speech Monday, Foster did not directly metion his proposal to help pay for the projects by making permanent a temporary one-cent sales tax that raises $110 million a year.

Foster later told The Advocate newspaper that his views on extending the tax were already well known. He said his proposed $12.15 billion operating budget was $300 million less than the current budget, "if we maintain our present tax structure."
Without the sales tax renewal, lawmakers would have to cut $410 million from this year's spending level. The tax is set to expire June 30.

State Revenue and Taxation Secretary John Kennedy said the state could raise $50 million by pursuing 10,000 people and businesses who owe back taxes. He asked lawmakers to hire a private collection agency to collect delinquent payments.
